bibl.title: Letter from George Miller Sternberg to Walter Reed, December 20, 1900

div1.p: Sternberg requests Reed's monthly report for the month of November 1900. Reed did not submit it on time. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from George Miller Sternberg to Walter Reed, December 20, 1900
div1.opener:
All communications to this Office should be addressed “To the Surgeon General, U. S. Army, Washington, D. C.”
[unclear]
SUBJECT: Personal Report.
WAR DEPARTMENT,
Surgeon General's Office,
Washington, December 20th, 1900
Major Walter Reed
Surgeon U.S. Army
Camp Columbia, Quemados,
Cuba.
Sir:
div1.p:
I have to inform you that your personal report to the Surgeon General
of the Army for the month of November 1900
has not been received at this office, and to direct that you forward the same
with the least practicable delay.

In this connection I invite your attention to the requirements of para-
graph 116 of the Manual for the Medical Department, 1899, which should
be strictly complied with in future.
div1.closer: Very respectfully G. M. Sternberg Surgeon General, U. S. Army.
